row.process:
!start process
:IF &UC4RB_PROCESS_PATH# <> "" : SET &FULL_PROCESS_NAME# = &UC4RB_PROCESS_PATH#\&UC4RB_PROCESS_NAME# :ELSE : SET &FULL_PROCESS_NAME# = &UC4RB_PROCESS_NAME# :ENDIF :P &FULL_PROCESS_NAME# :SET &RET# = STR_FIND(&UC4RB_PROCESS_NAME#," ") :IF &RET# > 0 : SET &RET# = SUB(&RET#,1) : SET &PROCESS_NAME_ONLY# = STR_CUT(&UC4RB_PROCESS_NAME#,1,&RET#) :ELSE : SET &PROCESS_NAME_ONLY# =&UC4RB_PROCESS_NAME# :ENDIF
@echo off
if not exist "%SYSTEMROOT%\system32\psexec.exe" ( echo No PsExec.exe in "%SYSTEMROOT%\System32". Exiting now.. exit /b 1 )
"%SYSTEMROOT%\system32\psexec.exe" -d -w "&UC4RB_WORKING_DIR#" "&FULL_PROCESS_NAME#" > "%WINDIR%\TEMP\AE_RUN_PROCESS_OUTPUT_&$ACTIVATOR_RUNID#.LOG" 2>&1
set timeout_var=&UC4RB_TIMEOUT# set count=0
:waitLoop
!tasklist /nh /fi "imagename eq &PROCESS_NAME_ONLY#" | findstr /i "&PROCESS_NAME_ONLY#" > nul findstr /i /C:"&PROCESS_NAME_ONLY# started with process ID" "%WINDIR%\TEMP\AE_RUN_PROCESS_OUTPUT_&$ACTIVATOR_RUNID#.LOG" > nul
set errorvar=%ERRORLEVEL%
IF %errorvar% EQU 0 ( echo &UC4RB_PROCESS_NAME# has started exit /b 0 )
! Commented-out as this line causes the input redirection error (!?) !timeout /T 1
set /a count=%count%+1 if %count% LEQ %timeout_var% ( echo Waiting for process to start for %count% seconds .. ping 1.1.1.1 -n 1 -w 1000 > nul goto waitLoop ) ELSE ( echo Timeout, process has not started exit /b 1 )
:INCLUDE PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.INCLUDE.CHECK_CMDLINE_CMD@WINDOWS
